definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
to intensify/to become acute/to come to a head

sentences.chinese: 困難使他們之間的矛盾更加尖銳化了。

sentences.english: No selective area sharpening should be done.
sentences.chinese: 選擇性局部銳化東西不容吧可施用。

sentences.english: This filter will sharpen all the pixels on the layer.
sentences.chinese: 該過濾器將所有的層銳化的像素。

sentences.english: You can combine smoothing with sharpness and edge crispness to adjust results.
sentences.chinese: 你可以聯合使用銳化平滑和清除須邊來調整結果。

sentences.english: The Sharpen tool in Photoshop increases contrast in areas you want to emphasize.
sentences.chinese: 銳化工具增強你想要增強的畫面區域。

sentences.english: Sharpening should be set at zero (0) in the camera.
sentences.chinese: 銳化工具在相機設置中應該被調整到零。

sentences.english: Extends tool life, reducing tool sharpening and downtime.
sentences.chinese: 延長刀具壽命，減少停機時間和銳化工具。

sentences.english: Provides better results than Unsharp masking which is built into GIMP.
sentences.chinese: 提供比GIMP內置的銳化掩模更好的效果。

sentences.english: Also we can made the edge sharp by duplicating the vertex normal vectors at any intersection of faces.
sentences.chinese: 同樣我們也可以通過加倍頂點法向量來銳化邊界。

sentences.english: I referred some classic algorithms on fingerprint enhancement , such as the fingerprint enhancement by the unsharp masking.
sentences.chinese: 我參考了一些經典的指紋增強算法，如非銳化掩模等。

sentences.english: Sharpening a plane blade requires sharpening stones of various grits and a little oil.
sentences.chinese: 銳化平面刀片需要磨石各種糝和少許油。

sentences.english: This problem is aggravated by cache locality considerations.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題由於緩存擊中率的因素更加尖銳化。

sentences.english: Sharpening is to enhance the effective method of image sharpness.
sentences.chinese: 銳化是提矮圖像澄輝度的靈驗霸術。

sentences.english: Do not convert your image to CMYK and do not over-sharpen it for print.
sentences.chinese: 不要將你的圖片轉化爲CMYK或過分銳化圖像。

sentences.english: In most cases, you would sharpen the entire image by the same amount.
sentences.chinese: 在多數情況下，可以用相同數量銳化整幅圖像。

definition: lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
to make up/elaborately made up woman
Horse-Face, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology
